alert.note: Alert for Pike; Southern Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 9:41AM EST until February 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch. The higher end snow and ice accumulations are most likely across elevations above 1400 feet. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Pike and Southern Wayne counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening and morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation starts off as a period of snow, heavy at times early this afternoon. The snow is then forecast to change over to sleet and freezing rain by 5 PM this afternoon. The freezing rain and sleet will change over to all rain by daybreak Thursday. 1 inch or less of snow and sleet accumulation is expected in the lower elevations of the Delaware river valley.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorist to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadways, and traffic conditions.
